creditline: Gift of funds from the Regis Foundation
description: seated figure with short legs outstretched, hands on knees; vessel opening on back of figure; figure has protruding lips, uneven eyes and pierced ears
text: This unusually large vessel portrays a man with a hunched back, a common theme in ancient Mesoamerican art.  Individuals with this characteristic had a privileged position in these societies, often serving as attendants to kings and chiefs.  They were believed to have a special association with rain, clouds, the earth and caves.  The warrior's helmet and earspools on this example illustrate this man's elevated status.
title: Vessel
